meanings.definition: The next to last syllable in a word.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'banana', the penults is 'na'.
meanings.sent2: She struggled to pronounce the penults of the word.
meanings.sent3: The penults of the word 'elephant' always trips me up.
meanings.sent4: The penults of the word is like the hidden gem of pronunciation.
meanings.sent5: Remembering the penults of a word can improve your spelling.

meanings.definition: The second to last item in a series.
meanings.sent1: The penults in the list of ingredients was sugar.
meanings.sent2: He always saves the penults task for last.
meanings.sent3: The penults item on the shopping list was milk.
meanings.sent4: The penults item in the series was the most important one.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to check the penults item before finishing the list.

meanings.definition: The penultimate round of a competition.
meanings.sent1: The team performed exceptionally well in the penults round.
meanings.sent2: The penults of the tournament was the most intense.
meanings.sent3: The penults match had everyone on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent4: The penults round determined the finalists.
meanings.sent5: Winning the penults round boosted their confidence for the final.
